data.text: How will you manage the hose? Meaning how will you store it for ease of access, but secure so it won't dangle down into your wheels, gears, etc. Applies to any bladder in the frame bag scenario, but the pic with the long hose coming out of the frame bag just made me wonder.
data.author: Chris Miller

data.text: strap around a part of the handlebars with a magnet on it. Do the same thing near the end of the hose. Wrap the hose up towards the bar like brake/shift housing and snap to magnet. Been using this method with standard hydro bladders for years.
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: guess I need a better magnet. Tried that approach using the standard osprey magnets and they wouldn‚Äôt hold the hose in place.

data.text: A little tip. When you get it buy some Efferdent to get the plastic taste out. I put about 3 tabs in and let it sit overnight a couple of times and it‚Äôs a lot better now.

data.text: I have that Apidira bladder, am currently using it on the wolf‚Äôs lair route in Italy. It‚Äôs worked great so far in my Oveja Negra frame bag, very happy with it. It doesn‚Äôt cause the bag to bulge too much, my cranks haven‚Äôt touched it, and I can get a rough estimate of how much water I have left by just tapping the side of the bag.
